Array ([mode]=>parse_c_situation[adventure]=>4[name]=>You Are a Pirate[type]=>start[textblock]=>You used to be a nice person: hardworking, responsible, law abiding. But then your girl/boy friend left you and I guess you just snapped. You decided that you wanted to kill people for a living. It happened on "Talk Like a Pirate Day" so that probably had something to do with it. But maybe it was that you were really good at sailing. 

You've been sailing around for while, learning the ropes, as it were (see, sailing ships have a lot of ropes.. never mind) when the lookout shouted "Ship Ho on the starboard beam!" You pulled out your spyglass (being a pirate is so cool!) and it turns out there are actually 3 ships. 

One is a British escort, one is a cargo ship and one is a passenger ship. The wind is just right that you can cut out (isolate and board) whichever one you want. )

*sql9: insert situation (name,type,adventure,textblock) values('You Are a Pirate','start','4','You used to be a nice person: hardworking, responsible, law abiding. But then your girl/boy friend left you and I guess you just snapped. You decided that you wanted to kill people for a living. It happened on "Talk Like a Pirate Day" so that probably had something to do with it. But maybe it was that you were really good at sailing. 

You\'ve been sailing around for while, learning the ropes, as it were (see, sailing ships have a lot of ropes.. never mind) when the lookout shouted "Ship Ho on the starboard beam!" You pulled out your spyglass (being a pirate is so cool!) and it turns out there are actually 3 ships. 

One is a British escort, one is a cargo ship and one is a passenger ship. The wind is just right that you can cut out (isolate and board) whichever one you want. ')

(Hurrah for the Pirate King!)[textblock]=>You used to be a nice person: hardworking, responsible, law abiding. But then your girl/boy friend left you and I guess you just snapped. You decided that you wanted to kill people for a living. It happened on "Talk Like a Pirate Day" so that probably had something to do with it. But maybe it was that you were really good at sailing. 

You've been sailing around for while, learning the ropes, as it were (see, sailing ships have a lot of ropes.. never mind) when the lookout shouted "Ship Ho on the starboard beam!" You pulled out your spyglass (being a pirate is so cool!) and it turns out there are actually 3 ships. 

One is a British escort, one is a cargo ship and one is a passenger ship. The wind is just right that you can cut out (isolate and board) whichever one you want. [type]=>start)

(And NOT the Good Kind!)[description]=>You were wandering around the dungeon with a sword, trying to find rooms with boxes full of gems to collect -- the usual thing. Along about the fifth room, you went in and there were a bunch of trolls. Not just one or two but like a whole troll rotary club. You reached for your sword but before it was even out of your scabbard, something hit you and you woke up in this room. 

Everyone told you it was a bad idea to go alone and maybe they were right but how would a party of 4 helped against a dozen trolls? 

There are no trolls here now but you can sure smell them and it's dark but you can see enough to know it's not a tidy room. 

They took your sword and all your other possessions except your clothes. 

There's a door and a barred window.
